title: language_test1_10
prompt:
What is the best way to complete blank 10?

![dropdown:Drop_Down_542_53] Mariana Trench is difficult to explore, our information about the trench comes from only a few expeditions.
feedback: The correct answer is “Because the.” The sentence should read: “Because the Mariana Trench is difficult to explore, our information about the trench comes from only a few expeditions.” This question is checking your understanding of dependent, or subordinate, clauses. A subordinate clause has a subject and verb, but it is not the main clause of the sentence. It has a dependent clause word, which shows the relationship between the dependent clause and the main clause. In this case, “because” is the best dependent clause word, since it best describes the relationship. No comma is needed after the word “because.”
